Using colors is ideal for motivating the consumption of the maximum of nutrients possible in the meals. The yellow and red ones are rich in vitamin A (fat soluble) and responsible for keeping hair, skin and nails healthy; their best sources are carrots, beets, pumpkin and bovine liver. The greens are rich in vitamins of the B complex, and represented by the leafy ones like cabbage, mustard, chard, lettuce and arugula, which prevent anemia. Citrus fruits are rich in vitamin C and important in iron fixation and enhancement of immunity; they are present in orange, lemon, passion fruit, acerola, green apple, tomatoes and grapes. The white ones, such as onions, garlic, mushrooms, cauliflower, palm hearts, okra, are excellent in preventing cardiovascular disease and cancer
